thread.title: College basketball: Gonzaga Bulldogs picked to win WCC, again
thread.title_full: College basketball: Gonzaga Bulldogs picked to win WCC, again

author:
Bud Geracie

Bay Area News Group
title: College basketball: Gonzaga Bulldogs picked to win WCC, again
text:
Posted: 10/26/2015 11:08:38 AM PDT Updated: 10/26/2015 11:17:23 AM PDT Gonzaga was picked to win the West Coast Conference men's basketball title Monday in a poll of the league's 10 coaches. 
The Bulldogs, who have won the WCC regular-season title 14 times in the last 15 years, received nine first-place votes, the maximum allowed. (Coaches are prohibited from voting for their own team.) 
Brigham Young received the remaining first-place vote and was picked to finish second. Rounding out the Top 5 were Pepperdine, Saint Mary's and Portland. 
The second five were, in order: Santa Clara, Pacific and San Francisco (tied), San Diego, and Loyola Marymount. 
Gonzaga, which is ranked No. 11 in the USA Today Coaches poll, placed three players on the preseason all-conference team: Seniors Przemek Karnowski and Kyle Wiltjer and sophomore Domantas Sabonis. 
BYU had two players: Kyle Collinsworth and Chase Fischer. 
Rounding out the 10-player team: Santa Clara's Jared Brownridge; Pepperdine's Stacy Davis; San Francisco's Tim Derksen; Pacific's T.J. Wallace; and Portland's Alec Wintering. 
Saint Mary's, a perennial contender, was shut out. Advertisement
